messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
It looks like your device’s location services are turned off, so I can’t retrieve your current position. Would you like to enable location services so I can determine what city you’re in?
Sure, go ahead and enable it.

messages.name: set_location_service_status
messages.content: PermissionError: Location service cannot be turned on in low battery mode

Your device is currently in Low Battery Mode, which prevents Location Services from being turned on. Would you like me to disable Low Battery Mode so I can enable Location Services and figure out your city?
Yeah, turn off Low Battery Mode.
Location Services are now enabled. To pinpoint your city, I just need your current latitude and longitude. Could you share those with me? Once I have them, I can look up your exact city location.
I don't have that info. Can you still find out the city somehow?

Since I don’t have your latitude and longitude yet, I can’t automatically reverse-geocode your position. You have two options:

1. Share your current coordinates (latitude and longitude) here, and I’ll look up your city for you.  
2. Alternatively, you can open your device’s Maps app, tap the “current location” pin to see your coordinates, then copy and paste them here.

Once I have those numbers, I can tell you exactly which city you’re in.
I don't have the coordinates available. Can you do it another way?

I’m afraid I still need some form of location input to look up your city—either:

 • Your latitude & longitude coordinates  
 • A street address or postal/ZIP code  
 • Or even the name of a landmark or neighborhood you’re near  

Without at least one of those, I can’t automatically reverse-geocode your spot. Let me know whichever of those you can share, and I’ll identify your city right away.
